sentences.en: An error that will derogate from your reputation.
I am here not derogate the England players, but you know they've been always overrated.
sentences.cn: 我来这里不是为了黑英格兰球员, 但你知道的,英格兰球员一直被高估.

sentences.en: In fact, use a network to derogate, bespatter competitor, had emerged in endlessly.
sentences.cn: 事实上, 利用网络来贬损 、 诋毁竞争对手, 已经层出不穷.

sentences.en: People often derogate others in social comparison and the past selves in temporal comparison so that they can achieve self-enhancement and ultimately get good self-feelings.
sentences.cn: 在社会比较中人们会贬低他人，在时间比较中人们会贬低过去的自我，从而来达到提高自我，最终使现在的自我感觉良好。

sentences.en: Statutes are not to be presumed to derogate from international law.
sentences.cn: 不能认为制定法贬损国际法.

sentences.en: Such behavior will derogate from your image.
sentences.cn: 这样的行为将损及你的形象.

sentences.en: Such conduct will derogate from your reputation.
sentences.cn: 那样的行为有损你的名誉.

sentences.en: Such shameful behaviour will certainly derogate from his fame ( or reputation ).
sentences.cn: 这种可耻的行为必将毁坏他的声望.

sentences.en: Such shameful behaviour will certainly derogate from his fame.
sentences.cn: 这种可耻的,行为必然损害他的名誉.

sentences.en: The king felt that summoning a parliament would derogate from his authority.
sentences.cn: 那国王认为召开国会将损及他的权威.

sentences.en: The King felt that summoning a parliament would derogate from his authority.
sentences.cn: 国王认为召开议会将有损他的权力.

sentences.en: The parties may not derogate from or vary the effect of this article.
sentences.cn: 各当事人不得减损本条或改变其效力.

sentences.en: There are different kinds of risks which possibly finally cause the listed company value to derogate.
sentences.cn: 上市公司成长的过程中面临着各种风险,这些风险可能最终导致公司价值毁损.

trans.tran_en: to cause to seem inferior or be in disrepute; detract
